result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amari Shyere Davis

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witness A/Ulta Beauty Store listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:56 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant Amari Shyere Davis in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and reading of complaint done in court.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
The Defendant waives the preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on October 25, 2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
